Name: Battle Creek Farmers Market
Description: With a focus on Michigan grown and Michigan made foods, the Battle Creek Farmers Market is a great place to find fresh and flavor packed local foods from Michigan businesses. Non-food businesses are also welcome. The Market is held in Festival Market Square in downtown Battle Creek on Wednesday, 9-1, beginning in May and ending in October. Customers will find a family friendly market with a good variety of variety of vendors. Vendors will find a well managed and vendor friendly market. An open air marketplace under a pavilion offers picnic tables, restrooms onsite and free 1-hour parking for customers in the Hamblin Avenue ramp. Live music and other activities make summer fun at the farmers market. BCFM participates in Bridge Card (SNAP), Double Up Food Bucks, Senior Market FRESH, WIC Project FRESH, NHBP Elders Nutrition Program. Payment with cash, Credit and Debit cards as well a market issued scrip accepted. Contact us for more information. Visit us on Facebook and Instagram, too!
Address: 25 S McCamly St, Battle Creek, Michigan 49017

Name: St. Louis Farmers Market
Description: Our market strives to be a gathering place for our community members. We offer music, cooking demonstrations, and booth space for non-profit agencies. Part of our mission is to improve access to health food. We offer multiple food assistance programs to help us achieve that goal. Our market is professionally run by  a Certified Farmers Market Manager (Michigan Farmers Market Association).

Name: Lincoln Park Farmers Market
Description: Lincoln Park Farmers Market is a seasonal market focusing on locally grown fruits and vegetables, locally made specialty foods as well as and locally made arts and crafts.  Our mission is, “To educate the community about healthy, locally grown food, and promoting good health.” Our objective is Michigan grown/Michigan made by the farmer, vendor, and crafter.  With the emphasis on organic foods, the advantage of a local farmer market is that one can talk to the farmer who raised the foods that they are to take home and eat.
